isis.stitle: CF 500, CF 600 Fuel Tanks - Fuel Tank and Lines - Removal and Installation

warning.para: Do not drain fuel near an open flame or intense heat. To do so is a dangerous practice, which would create a hazardous work area. Failure to follow these instructions can result in personal injury.

step1.para: Raise and support the vehicle with the transmission in NEUTRAL. For additional information, refer to Jacking and Lifting in S10019.
Release the fuel system pressure. For additional information, refer to Fuel System above.
Disconnect the battery ground cable. For additional information, refer to Battery, Mounting and Cables in S08307.
Drain the fuel from the fuel tank. For additional information, refer to Fuel System above.
Disconnect the fuel level sending unit electrical connector, fuel lines and, if necessary, the roll over valve hose. For additional information, refer to Fuel System above.
• Plug or cap all fuel lines and ports to prevent contamination of the fuel system.
Disconnect the fuel transfer pump fuel line. For additional information, refer to Fuel System above.
Remove and discard the 2 fuel tank strap nuts. Position the fuel tank straps aside.
• To install, tighten to 32 Nm (24 lb-ft).
Support and remove the fuel tank.
To install, reverse the removal procedure.

item.para: On a dual tank vehicle, fill both tanks to the same level.

warning.para: Do not smoke or carry lighted tobacco or open flame of any type when working on or near any fuel-related component. Highly flammable mixtures are always present and may be ignited. Failure to follow these instructions can result in personal injury.

Fuel in the fuel system remains under high pressure even when the engine is not running. Before repairing or disconnecting any of the fuel system components, the fuel system pressure must be relieved to prevent accidental spraying of fuel, causing personal injury or a fire hazard.

step1.para: Raise and support the vehicle with the transmission in NEUTRAL. For additional information, refer to Jacking and Lifting in S10019.
Release the fuel system pressure. For additional information, refer to Fuel System above.
Disconnect the battery ground cable. For additional information, refer to Battery, Mounting and Cables in S08307.
Drain the fuel from the fuel tank. For additional information, refer to Fuel System above.
Remove the fuel tank filler pipe and fuel tank filler pipe vent hose. For additional information, refer to Fuel Tank Filler Pipe - Aft of Axle in this section.
Disconnect the fuel level sensor electrical connector.
Disconnect the fuel supply tube quick connect fittings from the fuel level sensor. For additional information, refer to Fuel System in the section above.
If necessary, disconnect the fuel vapor tube from the fuel tank grade vent valve.
Place a suitable lifting device under the fuel tank.
Remove the 2 nuts from the fuel tank straps.
• To install, tighten to 90 Nm (66 lb-ft).

note.para: Rear bolts are shown, front are similar.

step1.para: Remove the 4 bolts and the fuel tank cover.
• To install, tighten to 98 Nm (72 lb-ft).
Lower the fuel tank.
To install, reverse the removal procedure.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Tank Filler Pipe - Aft of Axle

warning.para: Do not smoke or carry lighted tobacco or open flame of any type when working on or near any fuel-related component. Highly flammable mixtures are always present and may be ignited. Failure to follow these instructions can result in personal injury.

Fuel in the fuel system remains under high pressure even when the engine is not running. Before repairing or disconnecting any of the fuel system components, the fuel system pressure must be relieved to prevent accidental spraying of fuel, causing personal injury or a fire hazard.

step1.para: Raise and support the vehicle with the transmission in NEUTRAL. For additional information, refer to Jacking and Lifting in S10019.
Disconnect the battery ground cable. For additional information, refer to Battery, Mounting and Cables in S08307.
Drain the fuel tank until the fuel level is at or below half. For additional information, refer to Fuel System above.
Release the clamps and disconnect the fuel tank filler pipe and fuel tank filler pipe vent hose.
Remove the fuel tank filler cap.
Remove the 3 fuel tank filler pipe upper retaining screws.
• To install, tighten to 3 Nm (27 lb-in).
Remove the fuel tank filler pipe and fuel tank filler pipe vent hose assembly.
To install, reverse the removal procedure.
Release the fuel system pressure. For additional information, refer to Fuel System above.
Disconnect the rear fuel tubes. For additional information, refer to Fuel System above.
Disconnect the fuel conditioning fuel pump and fuel heater electrical connectors.
Remove the retaining nuts and position out the fuel conditioning module away from the frame rail to gain access to the fuel tubes and electrical connector.
• To install, tighten to 15 Nm (11 lb-ft).
Disconnect the fuel tubes and water sensor electrical connector. For additional information, refer to Fuel System in the section above.
To install, reverse the removal procedure.
Remove the fuel tank. For additional information, refer to Fuel Tank - LH, Fuel Tank - RH, or Fuel Tank - Aft of Axle in this section.
Remove the screws and the fuel level sensor.
• Remove and discard the fuel level sensor gasket.
• To install, tighten to 10 Nm (89 lb-in).
Remove the screws and the fuel level sensor.
• Remove and discard the fuel level sensor gasket.
• To install, tighten to 2 Nm (18 lb-in).
To install, reverse the removal procedure.
Disconnect the fuel transfer pump electrical connector.
Disconnect the fuel lines. For additional information, refer to Fuel System in the section above.
Remove the bolt and the fuel transfer pump.
• To install, tighten to 52 Nm (38 lb-ft).
To install, reverse the removal procedure.
